de.polygonal.ds.Vector

type
class
implements
Collection<T>
A dense, dynamic array.
Complexity (Big O notation)
get()c
set()c
front()c
back()c
popBack()c
pushBack()c
popFront()n
pushFront()n

Constructor

new(?maxSize : Int)
parameters
maxSize The maximum allowed size of the vector. The default value of -1 does not impose a size constraint.

Instance Methods

assign(x : Dynamic, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?limit : Int) : Void

parameters
x If x is a class reference, the vector is filled with instances of the specified class and the args parameter is used to pass additional constructor arguments. If x is an object or a primitive value, the object reference or the value of x is assigned instead.
limit If specified, the vector is filled with n=limit elements, otherwise the vector is filled from 0 to size(). Existing elements are preserved if limit < size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError limit out of range (if debug flag is set).
Assigns new content to the vector by replacing elements with x.

back() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Vector is empty (if debug flag is set).
Returns the last element.

clear() : Void

Removes all elements from this vector.
Call compact() afterwards to make all elements accessible for the garbage collector.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError copier is null: element is not of type Cloneable (if debug flag is set).
Duplicates this vector.
If assign is true the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference. If assign is false and copier is null, the method assumes that all elements implement the Cloneable interface. In this case element.clone() is used for duplicating an element. Otherwise the method uses the copier function. The size of the duplicate is unbound (maxSize()=-1).

compact() : Void

To ensure the best possible performance, removing elements does not shrink the underlying container to the actual number of stored elements - they continue to exist even though they were removed. For that reason, calling compact() is needed to ensure that all removed elements can be garbage collected in the future.

concat(x : Vector<T>, ?copy : Bool) : Vector<T>

parameters
copy If true, returns a new vector instead of modifying this vector.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null or x equals this if copy=false (if debug flag is set).
Concatenates this vector with x by appending all elements of x to this vector.

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this vector contains the element x.

cpy(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or i equals j (if debug flag is set).
Overwrites the element at index i with the element from index j.

erase(x : T) : Bool

returns
True if the element was removed.
Removes the first occurrence of x.

front() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Vector is empty (if debug flag is set).
Returns the first element.

get(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Vector is empty or index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Returns the element stored at index i.

getArray() : Array<T>

Grants access to the array storing the elements.

indexOf(x : T, ?from : Int) : Int

parameters
from The index to start from. The default value is 0.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError from index out of range or vector is empty (if debug flag is set).
Finds the first occurrence of x (by incrementing indices - from left to right) and returns the index at which x is stored or -1 if the x was not found.

insertAt(i : Int, x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or size() equals maxSize() (if debug flag is set).
Inserts x at the specified index i. Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (indices + 1).

isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this vector is empty.

iterator() : Iterator<T>

Iterates over all elements in this vector.
If performance is crucial:
	  var myVector = new Vector<T>();
	  var a = myVector.getArray();
	  for (i in 0...a.length)
	  {
	    var element = a[i];
	  }

join(x : String) : String

Converts the data in the vector to strings, inserts x between the elements, concatenates them, and returns the resulting string.

lastIndexOf(x : T, ?from : Int) : Int

parameters
from The index to start from. The default value is 0.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError from index out of range or vector is empty (if debug flag is set).
Finds the first occurrence of x (by decrementing indices - from right to left) and returns the index at which x is stored or -1 if the x was not found.

maxSize() : Int

The maximum allowed size of the vector. Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element to a vector will fail with an error (if debug flag is set). A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound. Returns -1 if debug flag is not set.

move(destination : Int, source : Int, num : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Invalid destination, source or num value (if debug flag is set).
Similar to (memmove), the method copies num elements from the location pointed by the index source to the location pointed by the index destination. Copying takes place as if an intermediate buffer was used, allowing the destination and source to overlap.

popBack() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Vector is empty (if debug flag is set).
Removes and returns the last element.

popFront() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Vector is empty (if debug flag is set).
Removes and returns the first element. To fill the gap, any subsequent elements are shifted to the left (indices - 1).

pushBack(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize() (if debug flag is set).
Appends x.

pushFront(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize() (if debug flag is set).
Prepends x. Shifts the first element (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (indices + 1).

removeAt(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or vector is empty (if debug flag is set).
Removes the element at the specified index i. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (indices - 1).

removeRange(i : Int, num : Int, ?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

parameters
output Stores the removed elements (if specified).
returns
The output vector or null if output is not specified.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or num invalid(if debug flag is set).
Removes num elements starting at the specified index i, in the range [i,i+num].

reverse() : Void

Reverses the vector in place.

set(i : Int, x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Vector is empty or index out of range (if debug flag is set).
Stores x at the specified index i. Existing elements are overwritten.

shuffle(?rval : Vector<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval A list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError rval is null or insufficient random values (if debug flag is set).
Shuffles the elements of this vector using the Fisher-Yates algorithm. If rval is not given, Math.random() is used, otherwise random values are taken from the specified rval vector.

size() : Int

The total number of elements.

sort(compare : T -> T -> Int, ?useInsertionSort : Bool) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError compare is null: Element does not implement Comparable (if debug flag is set).
Sorts the elements of the vector with the quick sort algorithm. If compare is null, the method expects that all elements implement the Comparable interface.
If useInsertionSort is true, the list is sorted with the insertion sort algorithm which is faster for nearly sorted lists.

swp(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError Index out of range or i equals j (if debug flag is set).
Swaps the element stored at i with the element stored at j.

toArray(?output : Array<T>) : Array<T>

returns
The output array or a new array if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output array from 0 to size(). The method creates a new array if output is not specified.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object. Prints out all elements if compiled with the -debug flag.
Example: 
	  var vector = new de.polygonal.ds.Vector<Int>(10);
	  for (i in 0...3) vector.set(i, i);
	  trace(vector); //output:

	  {Vector, size/max: 3/10}
	  |<
	    0 -> 0
	    1 -> 1
	    2 -> 2
	  >|

toVector(?output : Vector<T>) : Vector<T>

returns
The output vector or a new vector if output was not specified.
Pushes all elements to the output vector from 0 to size(). The method creates a new vector if output is not specified. Similar to clone.assign(true).
